document_title: What is dyslipidemia? Causes, symptoms, prevention
subsection_content:
Dyslipidemia causes cardiovascular complications such as atherosclerosis, blood vessel blockage in the brain, heart or limbs. Each person will have different blood fat levels, so at the Cardiovascular Center, Tam Anh General Hospital, doctors will choose individualized treatment methods, based on assessments of the risk of lipid disorders. blood to treat the patient at the right level, optimizing the final result.
Every day, patients need to move and exercise for 30 - 60 minutes, 5 - 7 days a week to prevent complications of lipid disorders. Each person has different activity intensity, so you should consult your doctor before exercising.
Cardiovascular Center, Tam Anh General Hospital is equipped with a modern bicycle dynamometer stress echocardiography system, with a load capacity of up to 140 kg, remote motor control, short survey time, and images. clear and precise. This test not only helps detect abnormalities in the heart early, but also determines the maximum level of exertion of the person performing it.
To schedule an examination, screening and treatment of blood lipid disorders at Tam Anh General Hospital System, please contact:
To prevent dyslipidemia, according to recommendations of the American Heart Association (AHA), each person should not tolerate more than 6% of daily calories from saturated fat; Also avoid trans fats. Instead, each person should prioritize cereals, fruits, vegetables..., proactively have health check-ups to screen for blood lipid disorders and receive timely treatment.
